newsitem.title: NORWAY: Aker Maritime stock falls sharply.
newsitem.headline: Aker Maritime stock falls sharply.

text.p: Shares in Norwegian offshore services company Aker Maritime ASA slumped 16 percent in early afternoon trade on Wednesday following the release of 1996 results.

Aker Maritime shares were down 20 crowns at 105 crowns at 1230gmt on the Oslo Bourse after deputy managing director Tor Bergstroem told a presentation for analysts that the company would have to work hard to live up to market expectations this year. Turnover was 27 million crowns.
The share at first fell a few crowns after the company announced profits before tax of 301 million crowns, despite it being a rise of 70 percent on the year-earlier period.
